data.title: Our Go-to Place for 30+ Years!
data.text: Colima is a fast, friendly, family place with great Mexican food. Chips and salsa are brought to your table along with the menus. Our favorites are their burritos for a quick dinner, but there are lots of choices from shrimp cocktail to fajitas. The service is excellent, and many of the servers have been there for years, a sure sign that Colima is also a good place to work.

data.title: One of my Go-To Mexican restaurants
data.text: There are no shortage of great Mexican restaurants here is Visalia.  I think Colima's is one of the best.  They are always busy (you know that means something!) and I have never been disappointed in the food or service.

data.title: Excellent
data.text: Excellent food and service every time I've been here.  I try something different every time and never disappointed.

data.title: Best shrimp ever!
data.text: My family was visiting the area on the way to the Sequoia National Park. We decided to stop here for dinner because we love Mexican food. They had the best Camarones al mojo de ajo that I have ever eaten! They also let my picky son order breakfast for dinner which was so nice of them! My only complaint was that his sausage was over cooked and burned. Too bad we live so far away or I'd be back soon!

data.title: Finally, Quality Mexican
data.text: My wife and I have only lived in the Tulare/Visalia area for 18 months. Too bad it took that long to find Colima. Wife was very pleased that she finally found a place that served chili rellenos with a white sauce. I could tell that the chicken in my enchiladas was slow simmered for flavor. The tortillas were very fresh. Looks like we found our go to place.

data.title: They got it right !!
data.text: Nice downtown location, great food and excellent service. We are happy campers. Keep it up, guys !! Great range of drinks too.

data.title: Best Guacamole in town
data.text: I have eaten at this place regularly since it opened. The service is great, the food is better. If you need to get in and out but don't want fast food dining this is a great choice.

data.title: Regular Spot
data.text: It is a smaller restaurant, but we get amazing customer service and the food is always great. This place quickly has been a regular spot for us. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone

data.title: Good food, friendly people, superb margaritas
data.text: We ate at the Colima Retaurant at 500 S. Linwood St. But TA doesn't have an address for that one. So, assuming the Main Street and Linwood St. are the same people, here goes: we chose it mainly because it was walking distance from our hotel. Good choice. The restaurant is neat, clean, and friendly. Service is prompt, and the prices are reasonable, especially considering the plentiful platefuls: shredded beef tacos stuffed to overflowing, well-filled enchiladas, and tangy but flavorful rellenos. Plus the beans (tasty) and rice (moist, flavorful). Ordering the combo plates may be ho-hum to some, but we think it's a good sampler of what the restaurant can do. The margaritas were tart and ice cold (the cactus stem glasses were a fun touch), and our waitress came by a couple of times to make sure everything was OK. Definitely worth your patronage.

data.title: Great food and great prices. Love the chips and salsa!!
data.text: I'll admit when I sit down, I always ask for the green sauce instead of red to enjoy with my chips. Its what they use on top of burritos etc and comes hot from the stove top. Nice to dip the chips into :-)  I'm a simple Mexican food eater; bean, rice and egg burrito with green sauce and cheese on the top, bean quesadilla or nachos. Colima has a lot of seafood choices though for those that have that desire. I always love the food I get here and if I need to call ahead and eat it in to save time, I can do that.

data.title: Very deliciois, fair prices
data.text: For sure got my bang for my buck. Chimichungas off lunch menu have been my fabe dish. Easy and quick for a lunch or a casial dinner.

data.title: Food made of nightmares.
data.text: Yes, tacos made from nightmares. Strange flavors,gelatinous meat objects in my Al Pastor. And to make matters worse, stale chips and tasteless salsa which didn't kill the strange flavors. How is this possible? Needless to say I won't be returning.

data.title: Good food!
data.text: Every time I'm in town, I always visit this place. The food is always good and the beer is cold! Not far from Marriott Hotel.

data.title: Great
data.text:
Service is tremendous!

This Mexican restaurant is a great value. The food is of high quality. This is definitely a local's favorite.

data.title: Walking distance from Marriott
data.text: This little restaurant is walking distance from the Marriott hotel. It's small but quaint and very clean. The food was average... nothing memorable. It satisfied us for the moment, but not quality Mexican food.

data.title: favorite mex  place
data.text: We have been coming here for 20 years at least and love it. great food, and the best thing is great service!  Get food in 4-5 min.

data.title: Great Value
data.text: This place was recommended and we were not disappointed.  Lots of chicken and fish in the tacos.  The chile rellano was excellent.  The food was fresh.  The margaritas were also very good.  A basket of fresh chips came with the meal.

data.title: Best Fajitas Anywhere
data.text: This is our favorite Mexican restaurant anywhere.  Great food, great service.  Always consistent. Fajitas cannot be beat.

data.title: Visalia Local Favorite
data.text: Colima's is a favorite of Visalia families and business people.  They have a small meeting room in the back that you can ask for if you're in town for business and want a quiet place to talk while you have an excellent lunch or dinner.  Service is very good and fast.  The decor is nothing spectacular but it is clean and practical.  Everyone I know loves their food so i would highly recommend it.

data.title: Best beef machaca in town
data.text: Best beef machaca in town. Can be busy during peak hours and after church on Sundays. Friendly staff and host and hostess.
